concise_definition: v. 储藏, 积聚; n. 储藏物, 积蓄

definitions.explanation_en: To accumulate and store a large amount of something, often secretly or excessively, especially out of fear of future scarcity or for personal gain.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指秘密地或过度地积聚大量物品，通常是出于对未来短缺的担忧或为了个人利益。
definitions.example_en: During the pandemic, some people hoarded toilet paper and hand sanitizer.
definitions.example_cn: 疫情期间，一些人大量囤积厕纸和洗手液。

definitions.explanation_en: To collect and keep valuable items, such as money, gold, or rare objects, often in a hidden place, sometimes to the point of obsession.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指收集并保存贵重物品（如金钱、黄金或稀有物件），常藏于隐秘之处，有时达到痴迷的程度。
definitions.example_en: The old man hoarded coins from every country he visited.
definitions.example_cn: 这位老人收藏了他去过的每个国家的硬币。

definitions.explanation_en: A large stockpile or collection of something, especially valuables or resources, that has been accumulated over time.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指长期积累下来的大量物品，尤指贵重物品或资源。
definitions.example_en: Authorities discovered a hoard of ancient gold coins buried beneath the farmhouse.
definitions.example_cn: 当局在农舍地下发现了一大批埋藏的古代金币。

comparison.analysis: “Store” (储存) 是中性词，泛指将物品保存起来以备后用，不带有情感或道德色彩。例如储存粮食或文件。而 “hoard” 暗含过度、隐秘甚至贪婪的意味，常带有负面评价。
“Stockpile” (囤积) 与 “hoard” 非常接近，都指大量积累资源，常用于军事、应急或商业语境。但 “stockpile” 更中性或正式，常用于政府或机构行为（如囤积药品），而 “hoard” 更强调个人的自私或病态行为。
“Collect” (收集) 通常指有系统、有目的、有审美或兴趣驱动地积累物品，如集邮、集币，是积极或中性的行为。而 “hoard” 强调数量上的贪婪积累，缺乏理性或公共价值，常含贬义。
